group_1.textLeft: Alright, this is where I take my leave...

group_1.textRight: Okay! See you tomorrow.
Is that you, Miss Satomi?

group_1.textLeft: You are Miss Tamaki, correct?

group_1.textRight: Yes. I'm glad you remembered me.
I wasn't sure about calling out to you since@I thought you might've forgotten me...

group_1.textLeft: Huh...
(She seems like a quiet girl...@Perhaps she has a nervous disposition?)

group_1.textRight: What are you doing in Takarazaki?

group_1.textLeft: I am on my way home from school.
I used to live here before I moved@to Kamihama, you see,
and I've continued attending@the same school.
group_1.textRight: Ah, I knew I recognized your uniform@from somewhere.

group_1.textLeft: You're aware of it?

group_1.textRight: That's right. I'm from Takarazki, too.

group_1.textLeft: Truly?!

group_1.textRight: I was actually on my way home after checking@for any deliveries at my house.
The local couriers don't seem to have@a forwarding service.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, that's right.

group_1.textRight: Still, it's amazing that you go to that school!@You really are one of Touka's relatives.
Does everyone in your family attend the@best schools and universities?

group_1.textLeft: Not necessarily.
Besides, given that I am just in middle school,@if I'm not careful...

group_1.textRight: Wait, middle school?
I'm so sorry - I thought you were in high school!
Um...what grade are you in?

group_1.textLeft: I am a third-year student.

group_1.textRight: That might mean we're the same age.@I'm in my third year of middle school, too.

group_1.textLeft: Really?! I cannot believe we are both@the same age and from the same town!

group_1.textRight: In that case...I can call you Nayuta instead@of Miss Satomi, then.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, that's right.@It's a pleasure to meet you, Iroha.
(I was under the impression that she was@a quiet girl,)
(but to my surprise, she's quite adept at@socializing.)
(Could this be...like those aspects we discussed@in class...?)

group_1.textRight: So have you made any progress on the@search for your dad?

group_1.textLeft: No. I've yet to find anything.
Oh, speaking of which!
Do you know if Miss Nanami is home today,@Iroha?

group_1.textRight: Yes, she is.

group_1.textLeft: I know I would be intruding, but may I@visit her?

group_1.textRight: Now?

group_1.textLeft: I so wanted to speak with her about@my father,
but when we met at the Coordinator's@shop the other day...

group_1.textRight: ...Do you know where he is now...?

group_1.textLeft: I'm sorry...I haven't seen him since...
I was in a hurry, and there were many people about,@so I couldn't settle down and listen to her words.
I was hoping she and I could discuss it further,
so please!
Take me to see Miss Nanami!

group_1.textRight: S-sure, I think that should be okay!

group_1.textLeft: Thank you kindly!
...Oh, goodness! I've done it again.
I was much too overbearing...

group_1.textRight: ...You're working very hard to find your dad.

group_1.textLeft: I would not say I am working hard...@It's more that I am rather stubborn.

group_1.textRight: Stubborn?

group_1.textLeft: You see, today at school...
...That was how the other students@described me.
I know I need to change my ways, and yet@I continue to act rude and brazen...

group_1.textRight: I can't speak for anyone else, but I didn't@think you were rude at all.

group_1.textLeft: What do you mean?

group_1.textRight: The reason I first came to Kamihama was@to find my sister.
I was the only one who had any memory@of her.
There were times people told me it was@impossible,
but I believed in myself and kept searching.
Even when my team fell into crisis,
I refused to give up.
That's why everyone calls me stubborn, too.

group_1.textLeft: Really...?

group_1.textRight: I've also been told I'm pretty meddlesome...
It seems as though we're both pretty alike.

group_1.textLeft: That may be so.

group_1.textRight: Two stubborn fifteen-year-olds from Takarazaki,@who came to Kamihama to find their loved one...
We really do have a lot in common.

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* When you put it like that...
While it may be an oversimplification@of our affairs,
it reassures me nonetheless as I continue@the search for my father.
